newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanese pound strengthens after government formed.
newsitem.headline: Lebanese pound strengthens after government formed.

text.p: The Lebanese pound strengthened on Friday against the U.S. dollar after the formation of Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri's new government, dealers said.
The dollar traded on the Beirut interbank market at 1,552.5/1,553.5 pounds, at the lower end of the central bank's intervention band and down from Thursday's 1,554/1,555, they said.
"The market has been comforted by the fact that the government has been formed," a dealer told Reuters. "It was expected, but the uncertainty, no matter how small it was, has been eliminated."
The Beirut interbank market trades within an intervention band introduced by the Bank of Lebanon on September 24 and currently set at 1,552/1,559 pounds per dollar.
Trading volume was not too big, the dealer added.
Dealers said they saw no fundamental changes in the composition of the new 30-member cabinet announced on Thursday evening and expected no changes in economic policy.
